comment: Professor Goldfine or Coach Bernie was great throughout the semester when I needed help. The class was super easy if you do the work (which takes no time) and submit assignments on time. 95% of the battle was simply turning in the work on time. He was super understanding when difficult circumstances arose and helped me out big time when I needed it

Very nice guy, but not a great professor. He doesn't put grades in during the semester (it is currently December and there is not a single grade in D2L). He also assigns a great deal of work towards the end of the semester, which isn't very beneficial for students. Attendance is mandatory.

Such an easy A class! He's has a lot of empathy and is willing to help out as much as he can due to grades. His class is very easy just stay on top of your work which you have about 2-3 weeks to finish each module.

Easy class for an elective, but you also get to learn so much vital information. Dr. Goldfine is very accessible if you have any questions. Assignments are easy and can be completed the day they are due.

Whole class & assignments are very confusing & all over the place. Makes the class difficult for no reason. I had to buy 2 textbooks because 1 was required to complete activities/quizzes & the other was required reading. I only took this class for an elective credit & he made it very difficult. Wont recommend him for this class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Easy A for Well1000. Assignments and online book are all in the same program. Very clear + simple. Would take again.

I took this class for my coaching minor. Here is where Dr. Goldfine failed at being a teacher. He doesn't explain the material very well, and while I thought I was learning how to coach volleyball, I was learning how to play... again. He doesn't post grades, and he doesn't prep you for exams. Also, he doesn't care if his students are disruptive.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I took professor Goldfine's class over the maymester period. He made an almost five hour class a lot more bearable! If you do the assignments on bearface, show up to class/participate, and do fairly well on the final you're guaranteed an A.
